article.description: Derrick Zimmerman had 15 points and eight assists in his final home game as No. 23 Mississippi State clinched the Southeastern Conference West title with a 67-45 victory over Auburn on Saturday.
article.headline: Bulldogs earn first-round tournament bye
article.linkText: Mississippi State beats Auburn to snare SEC West
article.story:
STARKVILLE, Miss. (AP) -- Derrick Zimmerman had 15 points and
eight assists in his final home game as Mississippi State (No. 21 ESPN/USA Today, No. 23 AP) 
clinched the Southeastern Conference West title with a 67-45
victory over Auburn on Saturday.

	   Mississippi State (19-8, 9-7) won the West Division for the
first time since 1995-96, and earned a bye in next week's
conference tournament.

	   Auburn (19-10, 8-8) finished the season losing five of seven and
tied for second in the division with surging LSU, which beat
Alabama on Saturday.

	   The Tigers will be the No. 2 seed in the West by virtue of
tiebreakers with LSU and also earned a bye into the quarterfinals
of the conference tournament.

	   The Bulldogs routed the Tigers for the second time this season,
putting the game away by outscoring Auburn 15-0 over a span of 7:43
in the second half.

	   Zimmerman highlighted the decisive run with a 3 to start it, a
one-handed driving dunk and a perfectly thrown alley-oop from just
inside midcourt that Timmy Bowers slammed home.

	   When the siege was over, the Bulldogs led 52-24 with just under
10 minutes left.

	   Bowers had 14 points and Michal Ignerski, another senior who was
honored with Zimmerman before the game, had 12.

	   Zimmerman, the 6-foot-3 point guard, also had two crowd pleasing
blocked shots in the first half, one going way above the rim to
deny an Auburn layup.

	   When Zimmerman left the game with 43 seconds he received a
standing ovation and hug from coach Rick Stansbury.

	   Mississippi State hounded Marquis Daniels into 7-for-18 shooting
and held the Tigers' best player to 14 points. He wasn't the only
Tiger misfiring. Auburn shot 36 percent from the field and was held
under 50 points for just the second time this season -- both by
Mississippi State.

	   Mississippi State won at Auburn 63-46 last month.

	   The Bulldogs were coming off of two lackluster road losses in
which they scored a total of 100 points.

	   Playing for a division title on their homecourt seemed to put
the jump back in the Bulldogs' game. Not to mention the accuracy
back in their jump shots.

	   Mississippi State took a 20-6 lead with Zimmerman hitting two
3-pointers in the first 7:12.

	   The Tigers scored five straight points and looked like they had
weathered the storm when Mississippi State scored seven straight
with the help of two careless turnovers by Auburn to go up 27-11
with 5:50 left.

	   The Bulldogs finished the half with six 3-pointers, 12 forced
turnovers and a 33-17 lead, despite leading scorer Mario Austin
having two fouls, no points and no shots.

	   Austin finished with eight points and seven rebounds.
